za.ac.salt.pipt.common
Class GenericSpectrum

java.lang.Object
  za.ac.salt.pipt.common.Grid
      za.ac.salt.pipt.common.GenericSpectrum
All Implemented Interfaces:
AllowingPropertyChanges, PiptData, PiptSafelyAccessible
Direct Known Subclasses:
ABReference, Blackbody, EmissionLine, GridSpectrum, KC96GalaxyTemplate, KuruczModel, PowerLaw, TargetSpectrum, UserSuppliedSpectrum
public abstract class GenericSpectrum
extends Grid
implements PiptData

This class describes a generic spectrum. It provides abstract methods for obtaining the flux at some wavelength and for getting the name of the spectrum, and it offers the method for firing property change events and for adding and removing property change listeners. In addition it provides methods for setting the grid describing the spectrum, resampling with area preservation and quantizing.

Constructor Detail

GenericSpectrum

public GenericSpectrum()
Creates the grid describing this spectrum with the default values for the abscissa starting value, resolution and range. The setting of the actual grid values must be carried out elsewhere by means of the setGridValues() method.

GenericSpectrum

public GenericSpectrum(int lbStartingValue,
                       int lbResolution,
                       int lbRange)
Creates the grid describing this spectrum with the given parameters. The setting of the actual grid values must be carried out elsewhere by means of the setGridValues() method.

Parameters:
lbStartingValue - the starting value of the abscissa, given as the binary logarithmic value
lbResolution - the abscissa interval length per bin, given as the binary logarithmic value
lbRange - the overall abscissa range, given as the binary logarithmic value

GenericSpectrum

public GenericSpectrum(double[] wavelengths,
                       double[] ordinateData,
                       int n)
Creates the spectrum by resampling the given data.

Parameters:
wavelengths - the wavelengths to resample
ordinateData - the (ordinate) data to resample
n - the number of data points

GenericSpectrum

public GenericSpectrum(java.net.URL url)
Creates the spectrum by using the file located at the given URL.

Parameters:
url - the URL where to find the file for creating the spectrum

GenericSpectrum

public GenericSpectrum(double value)
Creates a spectrum with the given constant value. The default values for the abscissa starting value, resolution and range are used.

Parameters:
value - the (constant) value of the spectrum

GenericSpectrum

public GenericSpectrum(GenericSpectrum spectrum)
Clones the given spectrum.

Parameters:
spectrum - the spectrum to be cloned
Method Detail

resample

public void resample(double[] resampledWavelengths,
                     double[] resampledData,
                     int nold)
Does an area-preserving resampling of the given wavelengths and (ordinate) data, using the wavelength grid of this spectrum. The resulting array of resampled data is assigned to that of this spectrum.

Overrides:
resample in class Grid
Parameters:
resampledWavelengths - the wavelengths which are resampled
resampledData - the corresponding resampled (ordinate) data
nold - the number of data points

quantize

public int quantize()
Quantizes this spectrum into photons and returns the result

Returns:
the total number of photons (per second) for this spectrum

integrate

public double integrate()
Returns the integral of this spectrum over the whole wavelength range.

Returns:
the integral over the whole wavelength range

setDiffuse

public void setDiffuse(boolean diffuse)
Declares the spectrum to diffuse or non-diffuse, depending on the value of the supplied parameter.

Parameters:
diffuse - states whether the spectrum is diffuse (true) or non-diffuse (false)

States whether this spectrum is diffuse.

Returns:

freeMemory

public void freeMemory()
Frees the memory required by the spectrum. As this implies that all the information is lost, the spectrum is marked for an update.

Overrides:
freeMemory in class Grid
